application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Change of use from retail (A1 use) to restaurant (A3 use) and single storey rear infill extension.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ( Unnumbered site location plan, Proposed plans, Proposed elevations, Proposed views, Received: 29th June 2020 ) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Prior to the first use of the site for the hereby approved use full details including manufacturer's specifications, colour and design of the extractor flue shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The extractor flue shall be installed in strict accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 4 - a) The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system etc operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 meter from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142; An alternative position for assessment /measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria is achieved. 
b) The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter. 
c) Following installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014 (Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. The post completion report shall be both completed and submitted to the local authority within 28 days of completion of the installation for review.
Condition : 5 - The hereby approved use shall only be operated between the hours of 8:00 am to 11:00 pm Monday to Sunday.

Condition : 6 - The restaurant approved shall not open until a secure storage area within the rear yard of the site enclosed by a two metre high close boarded fence to house not less than two 1100 litre galvanised steel Eurobins has been identified and made available, together with facilities for the separation and safe storage of glass, metal, plastics, cardboard, food waste and other recyclable materials which shall then be collected and taken to a suitable facility for recycling.  The storage area and bins shall be made permanently available before the development is first occupied and no waste shall be stored outside the site or other than in the designated area.  The lids of the Eurobins shall be fixed shut at all times other than when waste is being emptied into them.  Non-recyclable and perishable waste shall be removed from site no less frequently than once a week.  Waste shall be removed from the site to a suitable enclosed private storage area or an authorised refuse disposal or recycling site as soon as the bins become full if this is earlier than the time of the normal collection, unless additional covered and enclosed bins (as described above) have been provided and are thereafter made permanently available for the on-site storage of refuse and waste.  Refuse collection shall not take place from Kingsley Road.
Condition : 7 - Deliveries shall be made to the site via the rear access road and not from the Kingsley Road frontage
Condition : 8 - Delivery and collections shall only be carried out between the following hours: Monday to Saturday between 07:00 and 22:00, Sunday between 09:00 to 20:00.
Condition : 9 - The restaurant shall operate only within Use Class A3 of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 and shall not provide a takeaway facility before 6 pm on any week day.
